measured_by: Kent Face Matching Test (KFMT) – short version
justification: "Participants completed the short version of the Kent Face Matching Test (KFMT), which comprises 20 match and 20 mismatch face pairings" – indicating the KFMT was the instrument used to measure participants' ability to match unfamiliar faces.

"We converted these data into the signal detection measures of d′ and criterion… specifically to investigate changes in decision-making criterion" – showing that the SDT criterion metric operationalised the construct of decision bias.

"Participant responses … are influenced by criterion and d′, and the signal detection approach makes it possible to separate these decision-making characteristics from sensitivity to facial information" – indicating that d′ was the metric used to quantify perceptual sensitivity.
